Communications networks.What is a network: Two or more computers, and often other devices, that are linked together so that they can share hardware and transfer data to each other
Communications networks.List the main advantages of using a netw:
- Sharing peripheral devices 
- Sharing data 
- Sharing files and applications
Communications networks.What is meant by 'sharing peripheral dev:
The ability to share printers, fax machines, scanners etc amongst network users. 
This is significant as it reduces the total number of devices required in a workplace, saving money and space.
Communications networks.What is meant by 'sharing internet servi:
A single connection to the internet can provide email, web and file access services to all network users. 
This is significant as it allows you to access information at any time
Communications networks.What is meant by 'sharing data and infor:
As a user of a network, people are able to save and retrieve their data to a server on the network. 
This is significant as the data can be made available to other network users, allowing for the easy sharing of data between users.
Communications networks.What is meant by 'sharing network applic:
An application can be stored on a server in a network. 
This is significant as the application can be accessed by users (either by downloading or cloud computing) of the network when they need it, ensuring the users will always be using the most up-to-date version of the application.
Communications networks.What is 'cloud computing': A term used to represent accessing and using applications stored on a server elsewhere on the internet, allowing the user to save storage space and have a server perform computationly expensive tasks rather than the users device.
Communications networks.What is distributed processing: A form of processing in which the computational load is divided amongst multiple computers
Communications networks.What are some threats that come from wit: Workers causing careless of purposeful malicious incidents, damage from fire or other disasters, theft, mechanical failure
Communications networks.What are the two main things a network a: Installing a firewall and installing virus protection software

Fundamentals.What is a protocol: An agreed method of communication between two communicating devices
Fundamentals.Why are protocols needed on a computer n: They allow computers to communicate with each other in order to send and receive data
Fundamentals.What is the difference between open and: Open protocols are designed to that they may be used by anyone, while proprietary protocols are developed by manufacturers to work only with the devices or software they made
Fundamentals.What is the purpose of an IP address: An IP address is used to uniquely identify each device connected to a network so that data can be delivered to the correct place
Fundamentals.What is the difference between a dynamic: Dynamic IP addresses are allocated to a computer upon logging onto a network and are discarded upon logging off. Static IP addresses are permanently assigned to a computer by a network administrator
Fundamentals.True/False: Two computers on the same ne: False, IP addresses must be unique
Fundamentals.What are data packets: A formatted unit of data carried across a network
Fundamentals.Why are URLs used instead of IP addresse: URLs are much easier to remember than IP addresses, as they are written in a format humans can comprehend more than a string of numbers
Fundamentals.Outline why open protocols take longer t: Proprietary protocols are designed to suit one specific purpose, while open protocols need to be made in such a way that others can adapt and incorporate them into their products/services
Fundamentals.What is a Uniform Resource Locator (URL): A string of text that encodes the location (commonly called a web address) of a resource found on the internet

Protocols.What is hypertext transfer protocol (HTT: HTTP is a protocol used to transfer web pages over a network
Protocols.What is file transfer protocol (FTP) and: FTP is a protocol used to transfer files over a network
Protocols.What is simple message transfer protocol: SMTP is a protocol used to transfer email messages over a network
Protocols.What is voice over internet protocol (Vo: VoIP is a protocol used to send voice messages over a network
Protocols.What is internet protocol (IP) and its p: IP is a protocol that adds and reads addresses on data packets being sent over a network
Protocols.What is transmission control protocol (T: TCP is a protocol that makes a connection between two networked computers
Protocols.What is Bluetooth: A standard communications protocol for low-power devices within a short range
Protocols.What is AppleTalk: A protocol developed by apple to enables apple devices to exchange data and share printers on a small network (no longer used)
Protocols.What is NetBEUI: A protocol that was used to transfer data between computers on a small network (no longer used)

Data transmission modes.Why is there three different modes of da: Each mode was developed over time to suit different technologies and uses of those technologies
Data transmission modes.What is simplex transmission: Data transmission in which data can flow in one direction only
Data transmission modes.Why can't simplex transmission have erro: The flow of data is in one direction only, meaning if it gets corrupted while travelling to its target, there is no way for the target to make a request for the information to be resent
Data transmission modes.What is half-duplex transmission: Transmission in which a signal may be passed in two directions along a medium, but not both directions at the same time
Data transmission modes.True/False: The transmission of a video: False, this is an example of simplex transmission as data is flowing in one direction only
Data transmission modes.What is full-duplex transmission: Transmission in which data can be exchanged in two directions simultaneously
Data transmission modes.What are parity bits and what are they u: A parity bit is a 0 or 1 that is added to a byte of data so that there is an odd number of 1's in the byte. If the receiving computer detects that there is an even number of 1's, that means the data has been corrupted and it can request for it to be resent
Data transmission modes.What is meant by 'transmission': The transferring of something from one place to another

Data transmission rates.What is meant by the term 'bandwidth': Bandwidth is the amount of data that can be transmitted over a network every second
Data transmission rates.What is meant by the term 'latency': Latency is a measure of how long it takes for a packet of data to get from one point on a network to another and back
Data transmission rates.What is meant by the term 'baud': Baud is a measure of how many signals (for example voltage changes) that can be handled each second by the transmitting hardware
Data transmission rates.What is meant by 'ping': A ping tells you how long it takes a packet of data to travel from your computer to a server on the internet and back
Data transmission rates.What is the smallest symbol of digital d: The bit (binary digit) is the smallest symbol of digital data, with a value of either 0 or 1
